discussion.content: Answer is correct

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

discussion.content: why not "Teams Calling Plans"?

comments.content: I'd say calling plans, because it says retail users have mobiles with data plan. They can still connect to internet even if their company WAN fails.

discussion.content:
"Management at the new retail site wants to use Microsoft Teams Calling Plans for the users"
Answer should be A - Teams Calling Plans. Since management want it and there is no technical reason not to use it :)
Teams Calling Plans

Selected Answer: A
A seems the correct answer

Selected Answer: A
Should be A-Calling Plans
1.-It is asking about Retails. where there are only one or two desk phones. Why expending money on a solution that will be "oversized"?
2.-"The users report that in the event of an internet outage at the retail sites, they can use their mobile devices, which have strong reception"
3.- It mentions that users cannot use computers for teams desktop app onsite.

Should be A-Calling Plans
1.-It is asking about Retails. 
2.-"The users report that in the event of an internet outage at the retail sites, they can use their mobile devices, which have strong reception"
3.- It mentions that users cannot use computers onsite.

Selected Answer: A
Going with A. Calling plans will work.
The new warehouse will connect to a phone carrier by using a Session Border Controller (SBC) - "Phone carrier" Is that not telling us to use Operator Connect ?

comments.content: It's not about the Wharehouse but the retails.

discussion.content:
Should be A.
"Whenever possible, use natively supported Teams solutions."

comments.content: Read more carefully, it asks about retails, not warehouse (which is in Georgia).

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Georgia doesn't have calling plans. So the best answer in my opinion here is "Operator Connect".

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/country-and-region-availability-for-audio-conferencing-and-calling-plans/availability-in-georgia
Exactly - This question didnt show up on my exam. But I feel depending on random they have 3 various types they are publish but If I saw this it would be A. Calling Plan.

I would say "Direct Routing without media bypass". Annot be "Calling Plans" or "Operator Connect" because in planned changes says "Consolidate all its PSTN trunks by using region-specific datacenters, whenever possible". SBA is not required because in retail sites says "The users report that in the event of an internet outage at the retail sites, they can use their mobile devices, which have strong reception.". And to configure media bypass the SBC and the client must be in the same location or network (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/direct-routing-plan-media-bypass)

comments.content: I disagree. SBA would have been appropriate but since they have mobile phones with data incase of an outage why not just get Calling Plan . ?
Also it is without media bypass because the technical restriction "Minimize the amount of voice traffic over the WAN.". Without media bypass, media trafic uses always an Internet connection.
What you need is an SBA but since SBA's arent mentioned and you need internet for Media. I do not see why Calling Plan does not work here ?
@ivilalta - Calling Plans and Operator Connect do essentially consolidate PSTN services to region specific DCs hosted by Microsoft/carriers
That's for retail and not warehouse. Maybe you should read it again. covid_9 is correct.
thats for Warehouse not for retail i believe.. read it again.

discussion.content: The answer is calling plan ( A) - Read " The users report that in the event of an internet outage at the retail sites, they can use their mobile devices, which have strong reception" . So if there is an outage they can still dial out on the mobile phones with Teams Calling Plan.

i would say "Direct routing with media bypass" because of some technical requirements. And it says the users must be able to make calls even if there is an internet outage, that means we need SBA (Survivable Branch Appliance) and SBA can be configured only with Direct Routing.
Why not A?

questions.question_text:
You need to recommend a PSTN solution for the Teams Phone deployment at the retail sites. The solution must meet the technical requirements.
What should you include in the recommendation?

comments.content: I agree. User don't need O365 E3 because they have M365 E3. Thye need phone system for VoIP and audioconferece for dialin, and communications credits for toll-free audio conferencing

Communication credits is correct because of this technical requirement: All sales team users require inbound toll-free audio conferencing
Toll-free is possible only with communication credits.

discussion.content:
this is confusing because there is a info that all Contoso Users already have the M365 E3 licenses assigned, in that case the sales manager will not need O365 E3 license. 
But Phone System and Audio Conferencing is definitely correct :)
correct 😊

Answer are correct. The minimum license you need for Teams Calling/Direct Route is either E3 + Phone system + Calling Plan. If you have DR you need Phone system. For Audio Conferencing you need the add on plus communication credits or else you might not be able to call some countries. ( Plus Toll Free you need com credits )
Pretty sure, communication credits is just for Calling Plan, but this is Direct Routing.

comments.content: Communicaitons credits can also be used for dial out in meetings and for toll-free numbers with users using Direct Routing
Absolutely. Comm credits can be utilized for dial out functionality to certain countries which are not comprised in the existing pool of 60 mins per user per month.
I'd say it's E3 (need Teams app), Audio Conferencing and Phone System (Direct Routing), as it states "Direct Routing will be deployed for the existing SBCs.", so each user will need Phone System.

discussion.content: This is wrong I think. The requirements state they only need toll-free inbound requirements, and they are moving to Teams from SfB. In my mind, this should be an E3 license, Audio Conferencing (although now included within E3 subscriptions), and the Communication Credits. It doesn't state they are using telephony (although a bit silly a sales person isn't making PSTN calls!) but that's how I read this question

questions.question_text:
You need to configure a toll-free dial-in bridge for Teams meetings. The solution must meet the technical requirements.
Which three prerequisites must be met before you can assign the toll-free bridge to Teams meeting organizers? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

choices.E: From the meeting policy, set Allow dial-in users to bypass the lobby to On.
choices.B: Get a Dedicated conference bridge (Toll Free) number.
choices.F: Assign a phone number to a resource account.
choices.A: Purchase a Microsoft 365 Domestic and International Calling plan license.
choices.G: Get an auto attendant toll-free number.
choices.D: Assign a phone number to the bridge.
